intro: Conyza foliolosa, commonly known as the leafy conyza, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Conyza foliolosa is sometimes considered a weed but has potential uses in traditional medicine.
